result.execSummary:
The defendant Derrick L. Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
No contact with victim.   No contact with females under the age of 18.  

Maintain absolute sobriety from controlled substances unless prescribed and taken only as prescribed.

Any assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.  AODA and follow up. 

Sex Offender treatment/programming. 

DNA sample.  No objection to transferring probation.  

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derrick L. Davis

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

11:15 a.m. 
Clerk Micki.
INCLUDES 22CF580 and 22CF609

State appears by DDA Molly Lawrence; Defendant appears in person in custody from the MCJ; Attorney Thomas Roley appears in person.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

State moves to: 
22CF580
COUNT 2: Possess Drug Paraphernalia, PTAC, Repeater >> DRI. 
22CF609
COUNT 1: Child Enticement - Sexual Contact, Repeater >> DRI.

COURT GRANTS.

PLEA to: 
22CF580
COUNT 1: Possession of Methamphetamine, PTAC, Repeater >> NO CONTEST.
22CF609
COUNT 2: 4th Degree Sexual Assault, Repeater >> NO CONTEST.

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 3 years probation on 22CF580 Count 1, SWH for 1 year probation on 22CF609 Count 2, to run concurrent to each other; CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent; AODA and f/u; Sex Offender treatment/programming; Maintain absolute sobriety from controlled substances, unless prescribed and to only be taken as prescribed; N/C with the victim; N/C with females under the age of 18; DNA sample and surcharge; and CC.  71 days jail credit (both files). No objection to transferring probation.

INCLUDES 22CF580 AND 22CF609: No contact with victim(s): S.S.S. or their residence, no contact with minors under the age of 18. Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.   Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (2) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
